statement.p: In the model \displaystyle{A}={154.1}{e}^{{{0.0449}{t}}} what is the percent increase or decrease?
Note all numbers are scientific measurements.

solution.p: The percent increase/decrease is calculated from \displaystyle{e}^{{0.0449}}\approx{1.0459232623527}. Because this is bigger than 1, this is a percent increase and the result is \displaystyle{1.0459232623527}-{1}={0.045923262352691}\approx{0.0459} and the percent is 4.59.
We round to 3 significant digits because the measurement (exponent) had 3 significant digits.
